ajxpdriver.name: remote_fs
ajxpdriver.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Remote Server (via API)]
ajxpdriver.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Access a remote server implementing the Pydio API (most commonly a remote server with another Pydio installed)]

param.name: HOST
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Host]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Domain name or IP to the remote server, without http]

param.name: URI
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Uri]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Path of the API implementor on the remote server.]

param.name: USE_AUTH
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Remote Authentification]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Whether we should authenticate to the remote server or not. If yes, will try to login as an Pydio user, or with standard http auth if Http Auth URI is set.]

param.name: AUTH_URI
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Http Auth URI]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Path to the authentication script, e.g. /ajaxplorer/index.php (only if you are using basic http auth)]

param.name: TMP_UPLOAD
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Temporary Folder]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Temporary folder on the local server used for file uploads. For the moment, it must be placed under your ajaxplorer folder and you must create it and set it writeable by Apache.]

param.name: API_CAPABILITIES
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Api Capabilities]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Pydio plugins actions supported by remote server, thus forwarded directly instead of executed locally.]
